verses.verse: "Don't let your heart be troubled, you believe in God, believe also in me.
"There are many dwelling places in my Father's house. If there weren't, I would tell you. I am going to prepare this place for you.
"And if I go away and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you unto me, so that where I am, you may be also.
"You know where I am going, and you know the way."
Thomas says to him, "Lord, we do not know where you are going, so how can we know the way?"
Jesus explains to him, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
"If you had known me, you would have known my Father also, and from now on you know him and have seen him."
"Lord, show us the Father, that will satisfy us," Philip said to him.
Jesus said to him, "Have I been with you all this time, yet you have not know me, Philip? The one who has seen me has seen the Father, so why do you say: «Show us the Father?»
"Don't you believe that I am in the Father and the Father in me? The words that I speak to you I don't speak from myself, but the Father, who is in me, he does the works.
"Believe me, I [am] in the Father and the Father in me, or else believe me on account of the works.
"Very truly, I say to you, he, who believes in me, will also do the works that I do, and greater than these will he do, because I go to my Father.
"Whatever you will ask in my name, I will do, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
"If you will ask any thing in my name, I will do [it].
"If you love me, keep my commandments.
"I will ask the Father; he will give you another Helper, so that he may remain with you forever.
"[He is] the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it doesn't see or know him, but you know him, because he remains with you and will be in you.
"I will not leave you orphans; I will come to you.
"Yet in a little while the world will no longer see me, but you will see me, and because I live, you will also live.
"On that day you will know that I am in my Father and you in me, and I in you.
"The one who has my commandments and keeps them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and clearly show myself to him."
Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, "Lord, how is it that you will show yourself clearly to us and not to the world?"
Jesus answered and said to him, "If a man love me, he will keep my words. My Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our dwelling place in him.
"The one who doesn't love me doesn't keep my words, and the word you hear is not my own but the Father's who sent me.
"I have said these things to you while I am still with you.
"The Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and bring all things to your memory of whatever I have said to you.
"Peace, my peace, I leave with you and give to you, not like the world gives do I give to you. Do not let your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
"You have heard me tell you, «I am going away, yet I am coming back.» If you loved me, you would rejoice, because I said, «I go to the Father, for my Father is greater than I.»
"I have told you now before it happens, so when it does happen, you might believe.
"I will not talk with you much longer, for the prince of this world comes; and in me he has nothing.
"Nevertheless that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father has commanded, even so I do. Get up! Let us leave here."
